Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢 the tribal wisdom is "never modify a system Python/Perl/Ruby" outside of the package system, because so many system scripts are written in those languages and things break really bad when you do that. It's very common in the Perl world to break everything, just from updates some modules, not even the Perl binary.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: you want something like https://github.com/pyenv/pyenv

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and potentially https://pypi.org/project/virtualenv/

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: where were you with that advice 6 hrs ago?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: sleeping

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: all dynamic languages have these nice things now (pythonbrew, rbenv, etc..) to isolate things. It didn't exist when I was coding with dinosaurs in the 90's

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: I never could get it fixed and did a OS reinstall after 4 hrs of trying

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that may have been the best bet at that point, unfuckulating it gets to be NP-complete

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: the best thing about this setup is that my mouse gestures aside, a reinstall doesn't take very long 😃

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: very often in the past, at $work, i would git version control my module libraries, so I could fix this kind of thing, but you need pre-planning for that

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that way, if I installed a module + deps that broke shit, I could undo the breakage with git somewhat easily. That requires common checkpoints of known good working setups, which I would do once a day or so, when things changed

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
Some gamedev wants insight-api abilities to getUnspentUtxos for any address on the blockchain, from the daemon alone, no insight.  How much work would this be?

Also, they are enquiring about it on a non-komodo blockchain - basically want to highlight that what they want is heaps of work, best to write to insight-api and make game blockchain agnostic.

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content:
you can 
importaddress
and than listunspent

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content:
maybe duke can do that in a short period of time it looks like getsnapshot already has knowledge of all the utxo's
bool CBlockTreeDB::ReadAddressUnspentIndex(uint160 addressHash, int type,
                                           std::vector<std::pair<CAddressUnspentKey, CAddressUnspentValue> > &unspentOutputs)
so a 
getutxos ADDRESS might be possible with just an additional rpc call?

Content:

It’s for a dude working on digibyte integration - thanks for super detail response

Content:
just fyi
importaddress does not need the privkey it just imports the address but of course you dont want to import all addresses 😃

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: I didn’t know!

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Don't use the wallet and import address for that

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I mean u could but it would be unreliable and slow. You really want an addressindex.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: At the very least

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Mylo @CHMEX i think it would be possible with addressindex

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that would require merging bitcore into GAME, to be able to use an addressindex. KMD + all asset chains + HUSH already have these indexes

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @CHMEX i believe the internals functions exist at the C++ level, there would need to be an RPC wrapper to get access to them

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: to add such an RPC to KMD or HUSH

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: merging bitcore is a lot more work than writing the RPC wrapper, so if a coin doesn't already have an addressindex, bitcore is the big hurdle

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content:
```$ hush-cli getaddressutxos
error code: -1
error message:
getaddressutxos

Returns all unspent outputs for an address (requires addressindex to be enabled).

Arguments:
{
  "addresses"
    [
      "address"  (string) The base58check encoded address
      ,...
    ],
  "chainInfo"  (boolean) Include chain info with results
}

Result
[
  {
    "address"  (string) The address base58check encoded
    "txid"  (string) The output txid
    "height"  (number) The block height
    "outputIndex"  (number) The output index
    "script"  (strin) The script hex encoded
    "satoshis"  (number) The number of satoshis of the output
  }
]```

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: actually, it's already an RPC

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: KMD and all asset chains also have that RPC, it comes with bitcore

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: ah cool....pooor digibyte game dev then.... thanks for dbl checking @dukeleto handy for gamedev marketing

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: thank you very much duke! I tried it with addressindex and it works!

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @CHMEX no problem, i vaguely remembered that there were already various RPCs that sounded like what was needed

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: getsnapshot RPC is like a summary of running getaddressutxos on every address with utxos

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Mylo the fact that KMD has bitcore, maybe that is a reason for some coins to migrate to a KMD AC, so they can get all these indexes. Something to mention when people are wondering if they should be an AC or not

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: Noted.  Already in a draft for tech Tuesday and will go into dev portal. Eg game devs may want this functionality from a blockchain as has been seen over the weekend!!

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: I'm having difficulty finding API endpoints for Insight explorers. Iquidus explorers aren't a problem and Utrum has simple docs on site like this <https://ootexplorer.com/info> but I was wondering if we can add similar docs to some of the Insight explorers like <https://kmdexplorer.io> and <http://kmd.explorer.dexstats.info> It seems to me they would be helpful, though I may be missing something.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: I used this one <http://api1.barterdexapi.net/supply.php?coin=KMD>  to submit circulating supply to various coin sites to get market caps updated, but it was a pita to find (I didn't find it, CHMEX gave me it)

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Might also be good to add in that same information here <https://docs.komodoplatform.com>

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
@D.rabbani 
Are you still having wallet corruption issues? 
I have managed to engineer a fix! It is not merged to KMD at this stage. If you want I can push this change to a new branch of komodo for you to test it. 
Instead of rescanning the entire wallet on load, it simply removes the corrupt txns and then adds them back. about 7 trillion times faster 😉

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: @dukeleto would need to ask

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: probably calling a non sapling C library

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content:
@blackjok3r what does your code do differently than ```  -salvagewallet
       Attempt to recover private keys from a corrupt wallet.dat on startup``` ?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: it works

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: sick burn

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: what happened before was it would trigger a -rescan with `SetSoftBoolArg`

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: that would take hours one these wallets with over 100k txns

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: and the corrupted tx would still be there

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: instead it removes the corrupted txns ... then does `GetTransaction` on them, and if the exist it adds them back to the wallet

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: leaving the rest of the 99k txns alone

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: without needing to rescan the whole blockchain

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
https://github.com/StakedChain/komodo/commit/5837b5bc05338966cf4a62d21bed7e153ad5b3f0
https://github.com/StakedChain/komodo/commit/ff43475a31a04aaad2b329180dec4f4e5d99150f
Its not recovering damaged keys, but rather damaged transactions.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: this has only been an issue on ac_staked chains.... there is something in the code that causes it, but I tried 20 diffrent things, and nothign worked.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: this was the easiest solution/dodgy work around

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @blackjok3r ok, interesting. so it has slightly a different goal. Have you tested your code in dealing with wallets that have more than just a tx corrupt?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The code to "fix" corrupt txns was already there./... It just dint work in this case and it was horribly slow

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: and it needed a full rescan

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: you have to look at every xtn to know if it's corrupt, right?
